learning_objectives.objective: Recall the definition of fire resistance rating and its key criteria: integrity (no flame passage), insulation (limited temperature rise), and structural integrity.
Explain how fire severity, influenced by combustible contents, determines required fire resistance ratings.
Select appropriate fire resistance ratings for structural elements (e.g., walls, floors, columns) based on building occupancy and IBC Table 601 requirements.
Compare NIST BMS92 construction types (Type I: Fireproof, Type II: Incombustible, Type III: Exterior-Protected, Type IV: Heavy Timber) with IBC classifications.
Assess a building design's compliance with fire resistance standards for a high-security facility like a data center, considering cost, combustibles, and physical security.
Design a fire-resistant assembly (e.g., wall or floor) for a cybersecurity-protected data center, justifying choices with NIST/IBC standards and performance-based optimizations.
